availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married Susan E. Innes. Father of Hugh Innes, Gabriel S. Innes, Robert H. Innes, Tabitha A. Innes, Penelope Inness, Elizabeth Innes, Susan Innes, and Ann M. Innes. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850 and 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1850 and two in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 26. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 56. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 11. Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Forks Elkhorn, p. 12. Find A Grave. “Harry B. Innes, Sr (1802 - 1881),” Memorial #135932361, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=135932361 (accessed March 27, 2017).
